result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel A. Gans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Provide Sex Offender Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine + DNA surchage. Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel A. Gans

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
3:09 p.m. Defendant Daniel A. Gans in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. $50 fine + all applicable costs.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Knaapen concurs with recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:***********$50 fine + DNA surcharge = $591.00

Defendant Daniel A. Gans in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Comply with all conditions of sex offender registration.

Defendant Daniel A. Gans in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Atty Cousins recommends a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
